There is no such thing called development plan. In SkyWalking, if you want to do something, you could propose a design, discuss it with the committer team and try to send a pull request.

Present,  Can't perfectly solve the problem
I am planning to implement a new storage with ClickHouse , using MergeTree engine.
I am thinking to implement the other NoSQL DB as storage. But not ClickHouse, something like InfluxDB or OpenTSDB. @nauu
i found the problem, RequestTemplate#url miss the url part in the `http://localhost:8080/feign-scenario`,i will try to fix this

ClickHouse record its own metrics into ClickHouse each second by default, and also some other query logs ,its performance should be suitable as a storage.

And if we have a ClickHouse storage in SkyWalking , it will be very convenient for those people who use ClickHouse as a warehouse. @dmsolr

Clickhouse as a warehouse is not very suitable for SkyWalking process mode actually. 

Clickhouse is good at calculate things inside, but we don't need it.

We required high update performance, which is of an advantage of Clickhouse.

You could try. This is only my personal opinion.
This depends on your backend and storage. If storage is blocking somehow, the queue may be full too. You need to find out what is blocking.

It is already back in the latest release.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/68921210-ea052400-07b2-11ea-9634-33addf2e7398.png)

ok
Refer #3825

Hi, this is my current train of thought:
+ add a ```SourceDispatcher``` implementation to store ```ServiceInstanceRelation```,refer to the implementation of ```ServiceCallRelationDispatcher```
+ add ```getServiceInstanceTopology``` to ```TopologyQuery```  provide data query.

These two are right, but you miss one part. See closer about how topology generated for service topology. There is a `IP:port` <-> `service name` mapping by analysis segment ref data, but today, we don't save the `IP:port` <-> `service instance` mapping even it is existing in the ref.
Before all codes related discussion, a question, as this profile based solution, how should developers run the local test for both ES6 and ES7? I mean in the IDE.

> Before all codes related discussion, a question, as this profile based solution, how should developers run the local test for both ES6 and ES7? I mean in the IDE.

Simply switch the profile in maven tab

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/68995427-cc29e300-08c8-11ea-82c2-b7f35125eb07.png)

and I'm not sure if it's possible to achieve the same goal without using profiles, we have to build two distribution package, and have two dependency hierarchies

> and I'm not sure if it's possible to achieve the same goal without using profiles, we have to build two distribution package, and have two dependency hierarchies

That is why I proposed two starter module. After you have that, you don't need profile anymore. 
From my understanding, our project repo has been too complex already, if need profile to package different dist, it is very hard for a new developer.

Another thing, if you have the `exclude` and `dependency` right in new starter and storage, you could use most of existing es6 storage codes, rather than copy them again. It increases the payload to maintain codes. You should just need to implement the ES7 DAO, if ES API changed.
Proposal, design, and pull request are welcome. New storage implementation is open to 3rd part.
